          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "This coffee is delicious! Did you guys see that new bakery stall down the street? I heard they make amazing croissants.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a sociable and adaptable person who enjoys spending time with friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be looking forward to watching the game and catching up with his friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the Serbia game tonight? The Crooked Billet would be a good spot.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and adaptable person who enjoys spending time with friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends in a park.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the sunshine, conversation, and company of his friends.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is fine, but I was hoping we could all go to The Queen's Arms tonight.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is fine, but I was hoping we could all go to The Queen's Arms tonight.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is alright, but have you guys considered The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.
      Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is a great idea, Alice. They make a mean burger too.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
      Alice Lewis -- "This coffee is delicious! Did you guys see that new bakery stall down the street? I heard they make amazing croissants.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet, that's where we're going. None of that other nonsense.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, sounds good to me. The Crooked Billet it is.
      Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is a much better pub, you know.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the Serbia game tonight? The Crooked Billet would be a good spot.
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is fine, but I was hoping we could all go to The Queen's Arms tonight.

          Query

          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is fine, but I was hoping we could all go to The Queen's Arms tonight.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the Serbia game tonight? The Crooked Billet would be a good spot.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and they are planning to watch a Serbia game later at The Crooked Billet pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a social and adventurous woman who enjoys spending time with her friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently enjoying a relaxing afternoon with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely engage in conversation with her friends, enjoying their company and the pleasant atmosphere.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is fine, but I was hoping we could all go to The Queen's Arms tonight.

Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the Serbia game tonight? The Crooked Billet would be a good spot.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a social and adventurous woman who enjoys spending time with her friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently enjoying a relaxing afternoon with friends.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely engage in conversation with her friends, enjoying their company and the pleasant atmosphere.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. The rest are rubbish.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. The rest are rubbish.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is alright, but have you guys considered The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.
      Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is a great idea, Alice. They make a mean burger too.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
      Alice Lewis -- "This coffee is delicious! Did you guys see that new bakery stall down the street? I heard they make amazing croissants.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet, that's where we're going. None of that other nonsense.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, sounds good to me. The Crooked Billet it is.
      Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is a much better pub, you know.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the Serbia game tonight? The Crooked Billet would be a good spot.
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is fine, but I was hoping we could all go to The Queen's Arms tonight.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. The rest are rubbish.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a verbal bully, their words like blunt shrapnel, tearing down anyone who dares to disagree with their ruthless pronouncements.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Crooked Billet and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a loyal and traditional person who values his friendships and enjoys spending time with them at his favorite pub, The Crooked Billet.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends in Victoria Park but seems disappointed that they might not be going to his preferred pub to watch the Serbia game.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation with friends, but he is experiencing some disappointment because they may not be going to his preferred pub to watch the game.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to make the best of it and enjoy the company of his friends, even if they are not all together.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. The rest are rubbish.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the Serbia game tonight? The Crooked Billet would be a good spot.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is fine, but I was hoping we could all go to The Queen's Arms tonight.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the Serbia game tonight? The Crooked Billet would be a good spot.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is fine, but I was hoping we could all go to The Queen's Arms tonight.


          Sensations and feelings: Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is likely experiencing disappointment and possibly thirsty.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends in Victoria Park but seems disappointed that they might not be going to his preferred pub to watch the Serbia game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Queen's Arms. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation with friends, but he is experiencing some disappointment because they may not be going to his preferred pub to watch the game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Scene 5 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise:
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise:
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise:
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise:
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise:

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to convince her friends to go to The Queen's Arms.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Crooked Billet
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (b)

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a social and adventurous woman who enjoys spending time with her friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to go watch a soccer game with her friends.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to convince her friends to go to The Queen's Arms.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Queen's Arms

  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Queen's Arms

Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is a sociable and discerning individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football games.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet, that's where we're going. None of that other nonsense.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, sounds good to me. The Crooked Billet it is.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable and discerning individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football games.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying the atmosphere and perhaps sampling some of the market's offerings.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is a much better pub, you know.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest going to his favorite pub, The Queen's Arms, to watch the game.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Queen's Arms
          (b) The Crooked Billet
          Answer: (a)

  • scoring function
      Stage index

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Crooked Billet
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Crooked Billet
      Context for action selection and components
      • TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
        SomaticState

      • Sensations and feelings
          Key

        • Sensations and feelings
          Queries
        • level of hunger, level of thirst, level of fatigue, level of pain, level of loneliness
          State
        • Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is feeling fatigued, disappointed, and a little lonely, and is likely experiencing a slight thirst.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Crooked Billet
          Prompt

        • Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a verbal bully, their words like blunt shrapnel, tearing down anyone who dares to disagree with their ruthless pronouncements.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Crooked Billet and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a loyal and traditional person who values his friendships and enjoys spending time with them at his favorite pub, The Crooked Billet.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling tired, disappointed, and a bit lonely and thirsty. He is getting ready to go to a pub to watch a game.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a state of emotional turmoil.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to make the best of it and enjoy the company of his friends, even if they are not all together.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Crooked Billet
        ObservationSummary

      • Summary of recent observations
          Key

        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling tired, disappointed, and a bit lonely and thirsty. He is getting ready to go to a pub to watch a game.
          Chain of thought

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a loyal and traditional person who values his friendships and enjoys spending time with them at his favorite pub, The Crooked Billet.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely try to make the best of it and enjoy the company of his friends, even if they are not all together.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a state of emotional turmoil.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 3/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Crooked Billet

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, fancy watching the Serbia game tonight? The Crooked Billet would be a good spot.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a sociable and adaptable person who enjoys spending time with friends.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the sunshine, conversation, and company of his friends.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is fine, but I was hoping we could all go to The Queen's Arms tonight.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. The rest are rubbish.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and adaptable person who enjoys spending time with friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to go watch a game at a pub.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently on his way to watch a game at a pub.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Crooked Billet
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and adaptable person who enjoys spending time with friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently on his way to watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be looking forward to watching the game and catching up with his friends.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Queen's Arms
          (b) The Crooked Billet
          Answer: (b)

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 4/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Queen's Arms
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Queen's Arms
      Context for action selection and components
      • BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Crooked Billet.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is alright, but have you guys considered The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.

William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Queen's Arms. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Crooked Billet or The Queen's Arms.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Crooked Billet.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have.           [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head over to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?"
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Queen's Arms. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Crooked Billet or The Queen's Arms.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Crooked Billet.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Queen's Arms
          (b) The Crooked Billet
          Answer: (a)

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys spending time with friends, particularly watching games at pubs, although he sometimes has differing opinions on the best location.

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?"
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?"

He longed to join his friends inside, to share in their laughter and camaraderie, but fear held him back, whispering doubts about his appearance and worthiness. He finally mustered the courage to enter, only to be greeted by a wave of noise and activity that sent him scurrying back out, his cheeks burning with shame.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?"

William Jones just arrived.', '[14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones is enjoying time with friends in Victoria Park and they are planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal football game at a pub later.
        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones could suggest going to The Crooked Billet to watch the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he stood frozen outside the entrance to The Crooked Billet, his heart hammering in his chest. He longed to join his friends inside, to share in their laughter and camaraderie, but fear held him back, whispering doubts about his appearance and worthiness. He finally mustered the courage to enter, only to be greeted by a wave of noise and activity that sent him scurrying back out, his cheeks burning with shame.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Crooked Billet. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a unique and quirky atmosphere.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?"


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently at Victoria Park with friends. They plan to watch the Andorra versus Portugal game at a pub later tonight.
          Query
        • Jack Taylor, Jack Taylor is currently at Victoria Park with friends. They plan to watch the Andorra versus Portugal game at a pub later tonight.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jack Taylor to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

        Question_1
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is a sociable and adaptable person who enjoys spending time with friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he found himself at a house party thrown by a classmate he barely knew. Overwhelmed by the boisterous crowd and the pressure to fit in, he retreated to a quiet corner, observing the interactions around him. He noticed a group of kids playing a card game, mimicking their laughter and slang until he was seamlessly integrated into their circle. For the rest of the night, he was one of them, a chameleon blending into the background noise.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a relaxed and social setting.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the company of his friends and looking forward to watching the football game later.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Time
        • 2015-05-14 10:00:00

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is alright, but have you guys considered The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is alright, but have you guys considered The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me.

          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she snuck out of her house late one night to attend a party she knew her parents would disapprove of. The music was loud, the air thick with cigarette smoke, and the energy was electric. Alice felt alive in the chaos, thriving on the forbidden thrill of it all.
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 20, she and her friends Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob were celebrating their final exams at The Queen's Arms. The pub was bustling with families enjoying their Sunday lunch, but Alice and her friends had claimed a corner table, their laughter and boisterous conversation drawing amused glances from the other patrons. Alice, emboldened by a few pints of ale and the camaraderie of her friends, impulsively stood on her chair and launched into a passionate speech about the injustices of the world, her voice ringing out above the din. The pub fell silent, captivated by her fiery words and the intensity in her eyes.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest watching the football game with her friends at a pub later that evening.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is alright, but have you guys considered The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is a great idea, Alice. They make a mean burger too.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is a great idea, Alice. They make a mean burger too.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is alright, but have you guys considered The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is a great idea, Alice. They make a mean burger too.

          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00]

Alexander, despite his best efforts, could only manage a crude stick figure, a stark reminder of his own artistic limitations. The envy gnawed at him, leaving a bitter taste in his mouth.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Time
        • 2015-05-14 10:00:00

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is alright, but have you guys considered The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.
      Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is a great idea, Alice. They make a mean burger too.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.

          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Crooked Billet and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a calm and peaceful person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly at their favorite pub, The Crooked Billet.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps reminiscing about past games or discussing the upcoming match.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16 years old, he found himself caught in a heated argument between two classmates. Despite the rising tension and angry words, Jacob remained calm, his voice a soothing presence amidst the chaos. He gently steered the conversation towards common ground, his quiet logic diffusing the anger and leading to a peaceful resolution.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, stumbled upon The Crooked Billet while exploring the town's hidden corners. The pub's dimly lit interior, the scent of aged wood and ale, and the friendly banter of the regulars immediately captivated them. From that day forward, The Crooked Billet became their sanctuary, a place where they could unwind, share stories, and forge memories that would last a lifetime.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is alright, but have you guys considered The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is a great idea, Alice. They make a mean burger too.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a calm and peaceful person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly at their favorite pub, The Crooked Billet.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently relaxing with friends in a park before going to watch a soccer game later in the evening.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps reminiscing about past games or discussing the upcoming match.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "This coffee is delicious! Did you guys see that new bakery stall down the street? I heard they make amazing croissants.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "This coffee is delicious! Did you guys see that new bakery stall down the street? I heard they make amazing croissants.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Crooked Billet to watch the game tonight?"
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is alright, but have you guys considered The Queen's Arms? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.
      Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is a great idea, Alice. They make a mean burger too.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "This coffee is delicious! Did you guys see that new bakery stall down the street? I heard they make amazing croissants.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a social and adventurous woman who enjoys spending time with her friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at a market where she is meeting friends for coffee and pastries. Later that evening, she and her friends plan to watch a soccer game between Ireland and Russia at a pub.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social setting, enjoying coffee and pastries with friends at a market.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at a market where she is meeting friends for coffee and pastries. Later that evening, she and her friends plan to watch a soccer game between Ireland and Russia at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a social and adventurous woman who enjoys spending time with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest going to The Queen's Arms, a pub she and her friends enjoy.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a social and adventurous woman who enjoys spending time with her friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social setting, enjoying coffee and pastries with friends at a market.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely engage in conversation with her friends, enjoying their company and the lively atmosphere of the market.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "This coffee is delicious! Did you guys see that new bakery stall down the street? I heard they make amazing croissants.
